comments.body: Other animals are badgers, raccoon, lions, cheetahs,

A yeti like mob would also be really cool.  It could throw big chunks of ice or snow, much like the iceologer did.  Along with that, adding small ambient things like firefly particles or such would be a great addition.
Except what would these new mobs do? What makes them unique?
I've liked the idea of a yeti or bigfoot , some sort of wild, golem-like neutral mob

Goat 1: *looks at other goat*

Goat 2: *stares back*

Goat 1: *knocks goat off mountain, causing massive fall damage* It's just a prank bro!
A goat preparing to ram another goat could trigger a ramming contest where they but heads like in the wild.
I think dealing no damage would be kinda of weird since they're ramming into each other, maybe it would only deal 2-3 damage instead of the normal damage goats deal to players.
Bro, I NEED this
i want this so bad omg SO BAD
I was thinking 'stone meal' like bone meal but yes minerals is cool too
There can be generated deepslate emerald ore or deepslate copper ore, so it adds use for them!
Ciao
Maybe you could have 3 different skins for burning, freezing, and normal temperature?
If we did that we would have to add new buckets for all 5,000+ tropical fish.

we would have to add new buckets for all 5,000+ tropical fish

Not necessarily! Nobody cares about tropical fish, Axolotls on the other hand are cute and pet-material! Different colored bucketed axolotls please!
Unpopular Opinion, but I like tropical fish better. Probably because Axolotls are useless on Bedrock Edition as you cannot hold a tropical fish in your offhand.

You take the Ender spyglass and in a crafting table surrounding it with ender pearls. The "Enderglass" makes it so when you zoom in, you can click to teleport you to the block you were looking at. you would take about 3 hearts of damage, but it makes your teleports more precise. You could also make it so it consumes a ender pearl making it more rare and hard to get and use.
Maybe with Eye of Ender in the crafting recipe instead of enderpearls, because it make more sense. Actually very good idea :D
This is a great idea, I support this, it makes sense for structures to be made out of the corresponding materials.
KorakDuHart Thank you, Im not sure if mossy cobbled deepslate/mossy deepslate bricks are a block yet, but hopefully they'll become a new block!
Not only do the subtitles of cave spiders need to be fixed, but also the reach. Currently they're unnecessarily annoying to kill.
Great idea
you should be able to find any nugget if you're in the overworld and smithing tables in the nether.
Estaría bien que hubiera almacenes pequeños en los que hubiera dos o tres menas de oro o hierro enuna posición que pareciera a que estuvieran almacenadas manualmente.
can anyone translate that?
Redwood isnt being added because it would be too similar to mega taiga trees and the wood color is too close to crimson, although it would be cool if redwood was added.
Or if they won't put them in 1.17, along with bundles, then they could just combine 1.17 and 1.18 again but release it ALL in the winter as one massive update.

You don't really know what the developers want to do with them. They probably have some plan for additional functionalities for them, possibly even related to the Deep Dark. Releasing them now might possibly ruin the plans that they have for them, though I can't really tell. There is definitely some bigger reason for them to delay Candles, and we can't truly judge.
There is no point to adding something for the sake of it now when they already now they need to make changes 3 months down the line to have the feature work as intended
I heard some rumors about them needing to be functional in Deep Dark. I don't understand why though. There is not even Deep Dark in this update.

I like the idea of "orevein maps" as loot from mineshaft chests best. Perhaps the ancient miners heard rumors of a mother lode!  Right now oreveins are just very rare to stumble upon naturally. Having mineshafts point to the nearest one (perhaps only deeper mineshafts point to iron?) would make it more of an event.

 

This could also work if rarely the maps were to badlands with their high amount of gold. I prefer putting in-game methods to find things like this instead of resorting to map generation/search tools.
This doesnt make chemical sense, and making an inbetween Tier between diamond and netherite is nigh impossible.
sorry didn't know but just for fun.
Also I think it would make more sense if you could somehow get mercury like how its found or something?
also you can can upgrade mercury? to make it stronger?
why?
Don't know
Isn't Mercury literally liquid metal?

it needs specialties...like it melts but not destroys it if thrown into lava

that means, it has melted form which can be dried back into the armor/tool

also, it spawns in y level -60 to 10

But... mercury is... liquid? How do you make armor and tools out of liquid? Even alloys or "amalgams" are rather soft or brittle. I would like a thermometer though! And a barometer! So you can predict when the rain is coming!
You think you can make poison potions or poison tipped arrows
You think you can make poison potions or poison tipped arrows
Those are all great ideas!
It would also make sense for this to happen if you named the spyglass Dinnerbone.
Big Salmon
All squids should have random sizes.
this way we will have a reason to mine deepslate with silk touch

I got this idea some days ago, but I think it could use the top of blast furnace texture, the color is right and would look like smooth stone but dark. It should also be an alternative to smooth stone in some recipes like blast furnace, armor stands, ...
Yes, but it should take 9 times as long to offset the balance
i dont think it should be 9 times as long. maybe 6-7 times as long to give it a bit of an extra buff when smelting in bulk
This makes a lot of sense! A quick suggestion though: you have a typo (ram vs raw).
I also agree on making the process take longer.
The Warden is supposed to be avoided. It's like a natural disaster.

Great idea!
How about this being an „echolocation“ status effect instead of a permanent item?

No sé cuál es la razón para agregar madera de azalea si el árbol no existe en la vida real ni el por qué agregar los minerales en netherrack y endstone o la del cuarzo en deppslate ya que esos minerales no se obtienes en otros lugares y serían bastante inútiles
Good idea!
I thought this too at first, until i realized you get exp from smelting the raw ore.
But then you'd be getting double exp, when you mine and when you smelt.
Yeah... the other commentors are right. You get the exp when you smelt them.
I think the ingots in Mineshaft chests is what makes the loot worthwile. Otherwise, it's just like finding some ores on the wall in need of smelting.

394286328392 true, they could maybe add more of the raw ore to balance this but im mostly posting this as for inventory saving and to really connect the new items into the world, i do think with iron atleast ingots should still be findable but gold ingots arent really useful in caves

413785246472 i definitely feel that makes sense for atleast iron esp at lower levels, but honestly id rather have gold i can compress with the other gold i mined rather than an ingot that doesnt have as much immediate use
Yesss I thought the exact same thing!
I'd love to have the warden's heart as a trophy
Wow that would be one of the coolest things I could put in my museum :o (apart from the dragon head)
warden head seemed like the same as ender dragon heads
